input_args.examples: {'document_id': ['0000034', '0000034', '0000034', '0000034'], 'document_source': ['NIHSeniorHealth', 'NIHSeniorHealth', 'NIHSeniorHealth', 'NIHSeniorHealth'], 'document_url': ['http://nihseniorhealth.gov/heartfailure/toc.html', 'http://nihseniorhealth.gov/heartfailure/toc.html', 'http://nihseniorhealth.gov/heartfailure/toc.html', 'http://nihseniorhealth.gov/heartfailure/toc.html'], 'category': [None, None, None, None], 'umls_cui': ['C0018801|C0018802', 'C0018801|C0018802', 'C0018801|C0018802', 'C0018801|C0018802'], 'umls_semantic_types': ['T047', 'T047', 'T047', 'T047'], 'umls_semantic_group': ['Disorders', 'Disorders', 'Disorders', 'Disorders'], 'synonyms': [None, None, None, None], 'question_id': ['0000034-11', '0000034-12', '0000034-13', '0000034-14'], 'question_focus': ['Heart Failure', 'Heart Failure', 'Heart Failure', 'Heart Failure'], 'question_type': ['information', 'causes', 'symptoms', 'frequency'], 'question': ['What is (are) Heart Failure ?', 'What causes Heart Failure ?', 'What are the symptoms of Heart Failure ?', 'How many people are affected by Heart Failure ?'], 'answer': ['In heart failure, the heart cannot pump enough blood through the body. Heart failure develops over time as the pumping action of the heart gets weaker. Heart failure does not mean that the heart has stopped working or is about to stop working. When the heart is weakened by heart failure, blood and fluid can back up into the lungs and fluid builds up in the feet, ankles, and legs. People with heart failure often experience tiredness and shortness of breath.', 'Heart failure is caused by other diseases and conditions that damage the heart muscle. It is most commonly caused by coronary artery disease, including heart attack. Diabetes and high blood pressure also contribute to heart failure risk. People who have had a heart attack are at high risk of developing heart failure.', 'The most common symptoms of heart failure include shortness of breath or difficulty breathing, feeling tired, and swelling. Swelling is caused by fluid build-up in the body. Fluid buildup can lead to weight gain and frequent urination, as well as coughing.', 'Approximately 5 million people in the United States have heart failure. It contributes to 300,000 deaths each year. It is the number one cause of hospitalizations for people over the age of 65.']}
